note: Unix -- trademarked as UNIX -- is a multiuser, multitasking operating system (OS) designed for flexibility and adaptability. Originally developed in the 1970s, Unix was one of the first OSes to be written in the C programming language. Since its introduction, the Unix operating system and its offshoots have had a profound effect on the computer and electronics industry, offering portability, stability and interoperability across a range of heterogeneous environments and device types.
